creditline: The Ethel Morrison Van Derlip Fund and Gift of Ruth and Bruce Dayton
medium: Pastel on paper mounted on canvas
provenance: Eva Gonzalès, Paris (until d. 1883; her estate, 1883-85; her sale, Hotel Drouot, Paris, February 20, 1885, no. 70, for Fr 333, to Coquelin); Ernest Alexandre Honore Coquelin (aka Coquelin cadet), Paris (1885-d. 1909?). [Neil Fiertag, until 1998; bought from a small sale as by Isidore Verheyden, Paris 1998?; sold to Didier Aaron]; [Didier Aaron, New York, in 1998; sold, as Verheyden, May 13, to Artemis]; [Artemis Fine Art, Luxembourg, Geneva, 1998; sold, as Verheyden, November 6, to private collector]; Private collection, Sonoma, 1998; sold to Addison; [Addison Fine Arts, San Francisco, 1998-2007; sold to MIA for $ALTM]
signed: on envelope at bottom R, in black: Madememoiselle | Eva Gonzales
title: Pommes d'Api
